serviceTak.step1Description: Quickstart Guide tells you how to start using TAK on your device.
serviceTak.step2Description: The Usage Guide tells you how to use the application, according to our standard model.
serviceTak.step3Description: Download the Client Package and install it to your TAK device according to the Quickstart Guide, to get using the app.
serviceTakUsageCard.title: Purpose
serviceTakUsageCard.content:
• Real-time tracking of friendlies (GPS).
  • Send observations to the command post (HQ) for interpretation.
  • Follow the Recon Feed that your command post (HQ) creates for your unit.
serviceTakUsageView.serviceInfoCardDetai:
Take TAK to use with each platform with the instructions below.

The easiest way to do it, is to work with a partner where one fighter displays the instructions, and the other follows them.
serviceTakQuickstartView.serviceInfoCard:
Select the setup instructions for your device.
The easiest way to learn how to do it, is to work with a partner where one fighter displays the instructions, and the other follows them.
takQuickstartAndroid1.serviceInfoCard.de:
ATAK Quickstart - phase 1: install the applications
Recommendation: Pair up - one displays the instructions, the other follows them.
takQuickstartAndroid1.unfoldableCard1.de:
Download ATAK (1/2)

Download the ATAK-CIV app from the Play Store and install it. Download link below:

b. Download ATAK Data Sync-plugin (2/2)

Download the ATAK Data Sync-plugin, and install it. Download link below:
takQuickstartAndroid1.unfoldableCard2.de:
Download your client packege by pressing the green Download your Client Package button. You can access the same button from the front page, too.

Save the .zip file.
takQuickstartAndroid1.unfoldableCard3.ti: 3. Open the ATAK app and grant it the requested permissions
takQuickstartAndroid1.unfoldableCard3.de: Open the app. Grant all permissions the application requests.
If the application gives an error message, select Wait.
